page.title: 10THE LINHOPE BURN
page.content: The Linhope burn is one of the major tributaries of the river Breamish. It joins the Breamish just south of Linhope. There is a narrow bridge into Linhope across the burn. Along much of its length in this area, the burn is in a steep-sided valley which eventually becomes a deep gorge which has woods running down both sides. The burn is rocky and has large boulders in it along its length. It is narrow and fast-flowing with occasional deep holes. A major feature of this burn are the number of waterfalls along its short length. The best known of these is Linhope Spout but is just out of this area. The remainder of the waterfalls tend to be in the gorge NW of Linhope but are on private land belonging to the big house.
